notary.title: Notary - Łódź
notary.text:
Documents Required for Foreigners Visiting a Notary When a foreigner visits a notary, it is important to prepare the necessary documents that may be required depending on the nature of the notarial act.
Below is a list of key documents that should be brought along:
1. Identity Document - A passport or another recognized document that confirms identity, accepted in Poland. 2. PESEL Number - A PESEL number is required, and if the person does not have a PESEL number, a certificate of its absence must be provided.
3. Documents Related to the Specific Notarial Act - These may include property deeds, contracts, powers of attorney, certificates, or other legal documents, depending on the nature of the matter.
4. Certified Translations - If any documents are written in a language other than Polish, certified translations into Polish may be required. It is advisable to contact the notary's office in advance to confirm which specific documents will be needed for the particular situation, ensuring a smooth execution of notarial

experience.title: Experience
experience.text: Extensive experience enables the reliable preparation of notarial deeds and expert legal advice, which translates into a high level of customer service. The Notary Office of Joanna Czernikiewicz provides services to individuals and business entities. Our Clients can count on a personalized approach, dedication, and actions in their best interest. In performing our duties, we ensure they comply with applicable law and that Clients are aware of all their rights and obligations resulting from them.
